website_summaries.verdict: A durable 2-in-1 pot that can be used as a three-quart sauce pot or as a steamer.
pros: Constructed from polished stainless steel with a thick aluminum core for even heating
Use it as a steamer or as a three-quart pot to boil, heat, or simmer
Dishwasher-safe and oven-safe to 350 degrees Fahrenheit
cons: Some found the steamer smaller than they expected
The handles can get hot, to the point of smelling toxic

customer_reviews.title: NOT TOO BIG; NOT TOO SMALL.  IT'S PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and thought it would be too small, but I was pleasantly surprised. It's not large so it doesn't take too much space, but it's not too small either. In fact, it's perfect. I used it to reheat some food and the food fit nicely. Reviews mentioned the handles were getting hot, so I was careful. Nothing happened. In the end, I believe this was the perfect purchase, perfect size and good weight for it's size. I know it will be used a lot in my household.
customer_reviews.author: hula maiden

customer_reviews.title: Wanted One of These All My Life
customer_reviews.text: I had been using those cheap steamer trays that fall apart all my life and finally found this yesterday on Amazon. I ordered this specifically for the steamer basket that is included. There isn't a good picture of the steamer online so I uploaded my own customer image. I ordered this yesterday and received it today using super saver shipping. I have already used it and it is exactly what I wanted to steam my carrots, broccoli, and red potatoes. I am also pleasantly surprised by the thickness of the pan. Also, I'm happy the lid is not glass. I just think everything about it is awesome. Please see my uploaded customer images.
customer_reviews.author: The Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 23 year old man, I bought this to show my mother how wonderful cauliflower tastes after being steamed. After one use it became a big hit in the house, my step father and little brothers were steaming everything they could get there hands on. Perfect product for its use, it is a little small. But would be great for a couple or a family with a medium appedite.
customer_reviews.author: Swashbuckle

customer_reviews.title: Tried and true
customer_reviews.text: My grandmother always used Faberware and she cooked a lot....think big Italian dinners :) After spending a small fortune on some high end brands to only be disappointed, I decided to try Faberware. This is my second pot which I purchased to steam fruits and veggies to make my son’s food. This 3 quart is the perfect size, made very durable and super easy to clean! Check, check and check! I also like that you can use it as a regukar pot w/o the steamer!
customer_reviews.author: KPITTTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Well made Farberware Steamer Pot!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, sturdy, and practical! We bought this on Warehouse Deals and don't regret it. We saved about $6 more dollars. We didn't get a fancy manufacturing box, but we got a great Steamer Pot in perfect shape! We liked how the steamer tray keeps the pot above the water with a generous area for water, so the water doesn't dry up, and we get a good new usable 3 quart pot too. The inserts for s similar price didn't' hold the food above the water as much, which would allow for the boiling water to evaporate quicker.
customer_reviews.author: KC Royals Fan from Independence, MO

customer_reviews.title: Farberware pots
customer_reviews.text: The Farberware pots are fairly sturdy, but the handles are plastic and the pan gave off horrible fumes when heat from cooking surface came near plastic handles. The pots have a shiny stainless steel surface which is nice and makes them fairly easy to clean. Unfortunately, the cooking fumes sent up a red flag for me and I wondered how the pots layers were constructed. I feel they are unsafe to cook with.
customer_reviews.author: Jugal Baldev

customer_reviews.title: Is steamer basket stainless steel or aluminum???????
customer_reviews.text: I have asked Amazon and it doesn't know , of course! Have followed every direction from Farberware and cannot get an answer or contact a real person. For this reason alone, will not purchase another Farberware product on line. Might have to return a perfectly fine product !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Best pots ever.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these pots from the 70’s, the only pots I will buy, I have them in all sizes. They have a brighter shine than the originals, but just as good. Sometimes the handles can become loose but all in all very good pots. If you should burn any one of them, just soaked in baking soda with a little dish liquid and cleaning up is a breeze, then I use Bar keepers friend for final wash, and it’s perfect again. I will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Greyci Lew

customer_reviews.title: It seems like it should hold up to boiling water and salt
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. After the first time it became stained. It seems like it should hold up to boiling water and salt. The company said that stains aren't a manufacturing defect so they won't replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Rho B.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite steamer for years
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these 7 years ago and use one or both almost every day. They work better than my All Clad steamers and they can go right in the dishwasher with no worries. They held up really well except for the lid handle in both became loose with no apparent way of retightening. So I ordered 2 more. No regrets given the low price point. They will be put to the same daily test as the old two and I expect similar satisfaction levels.
customer_reviews.author: SignHere

customer_reviews.title: Well made, stainless steel 3 quart steamer
customer_reviews.text: You get the great 3 quart pot with lid and steamer insert. You can also use steamer insert as colander. Does not always keep shine unless washed right away. Perfect size for many dishes. Farberware lasts. I had to throw out many non stick pots which was a wast of money; some after only 6 months. My farberware lasts for decades. Great value. I use this pot on my induction burner. Works great; Comparative induction labeled pots are 20.00 more.
customer_reviews.author: Roz

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pot...great steamer, good quality,
customer_reviews.text: Love the size And versatility of this steamer. The steamer portion can be taken out and used as a regular saucepan Size allows for perfect cooking of small or large portions. Heat distribution is even and consistent. I use primarily for vegetables. Easy to store, easy to clean and quality is terrific. Strong knobs. I like that the easy lid removal that allows me to add vegs for different cook times. This is one of my favorite cooking pots.
customer_reviews.author: taswell

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic handles will burn your hands.
customer_reviews.text: How can you build a steamer, which is designed to boil water, with plastic handles that get so hot you burn your hands when you touch them? Cheap product, do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ward

customer_reviews.title: My wife really likes this steamer. Happy Wife - Happy Life ! !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is so well made and designed! We have changed our diet to primarily plant-based food. A steamer is a must to have now. We have an older Farberware steamer from the 1980s which we inherited from my mom. It works much better than any other brands we had used since, until returning to the Farberware brand. The three stars on the "versatility" is due to the fact this cooking tool is a 'dedicated' tool - it's ONLY a steamer and boiler, not anything else. Don't let that stop you from buying this well-made cooking tool.
customer_reviews.author: G Carlo

customer_reviews.title: Handles get too hot and they crack after one year
customer_reviews.text: Handles get extremely hot you need protection to lift off the food. After about a year one of the handles plastic cracked it got so hot so it's not very durable
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Love this steamer!
customer_reviews.text: I was given one of these steamers as a gift. Use it all the time. Sometimes I need 2 at the same time and I liked it so much I bought this second one. They are sturdy, easy to use, and with the nice cool handles, there's no fumbling and burning of the fingers trying to get the hot food out of the basket, as is the case with other steamers. My only "criticism", is that the size of this steamer is fine for most foods, but I do wish there was a larger version for bigger vegetables. Nevertheless, this is a great steamer, well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: BrandyShew

customer_reviews.title: The construction seems sturdy. However
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for almost a year now. I mainly use this for steaming vegetables and cooking rice. I have not seen any rust spots/ pitting/ discoloration till now. The construction seems sturdy. However, the handles will get hot if the flame is high. I never use stainless steel pots and pans on high flame and therefore never had to deal with melting handles. Comes out squeaky clean from the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Indranil Biswas

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pot - big bottom, small top
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful, well made, heavy gage stainless steel pot. We were looking for a larger stovetop steamer than those we had with a 2 quart pot. While the bottom is indeed three quart, unfortunately the steamer top is no bigger than what we had with a 2 quart pan.
customer_reviews.author: Jack  Berry

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it was with two small lobster tails. Set the temperature at 55% with my induction small counter stove for 9 minutes. Lobsters came out very well, but I did notice that I would have to have a heat pad to take the upper portion of the steamer off. No big deal. The 3 quart steamer would be good for one or two people, not for a very large family. Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: This is not good quality stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: Beware of this product, I tried to return it and now I can't because it's past 30 days. This is not good quality stainless steel, I have used it for cooking several times and it started getting rust spots at the bottom of the inside. Horrible product, do not buy. I don't want a replacement. I would like my money back. Brick and mortar stores have better return policies. I'm not happy at all with this purchase. Will think twice before buying through amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: HOT handles!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little surprised by the size, it's a bit small, like Barbie's Dream Steamer, but the size was clearly stated and that was my fault totally, so I'm not faulting the product over that. The steamer basket is nice and deep, it holds plenty of veggies for the two of us. That's good too. But the failure is the handles. They get incredibly HOT. I still have a blister from the first time I glibly tried to lift the steamer from the unit. Potholders are a must. That's not always convenient. Dishrags, etc. have been employed. If you buy this thing, BEWARE of the hot handles. I sure wouldn't let any kids near it.
customer_reviews.author: Casa Semanas

customer_reviews.title: It's a strong NO!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product when I first purchased it. I used it mainly for boiling or steaming. However I stopped using it because it gives off an order/smell when water gets to boiling point. I dont like it at all.
customer_reviews.author: ambreya ousley

customer_reviews.title: I nearly replaced my broken strainer insert with another like it, but saw this and read other reviews
customer_reviews.text: I nearly replaced my broken strainer insert with another like it, but saw this and read other reviews. I steam veggies a lot and found the center stem and ring of my old strainer basket difficult to use without burning my fingers. Decided to try this and will never go back to the flimsy insert. Feels substantial without being unduly heavy and is much safer for me to use - no fear of steam burns. In the steamer basket I tended to have burned/singed veggies where they touched the pot above the strainer but this has not happened with this one. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Earthling

customer_reviews.title: Good veggie steamer, wish it had a long handle
customer_reviews.text: Size is good: basket fits a cut up, large head of broccoli or two smaller heads of broccoli for steaming. Very easy to clean. Only downside is the handles become too hot to hold when lifting the basket up after you're done steaming -- so I end up removing items with a fork or needing two oven mitts :/
customer_reviews.author: unibudfan

customer_reviews.title: Ok quality with room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Ok quality, could profit from mirror finish inside too for easier cleaning. Properly manufactured 18/10 stainless steel would be significantly better choice. Some adjustment of the press creating the bottom sandwich is needed, there were some defects that I had to manually sandpaper out so now it is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Anguelariy Spassov

customer_reviews.title: It's not small, it's tiny..but it does the job
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews about this steamer being 'small' but in actuality, it's tiny. I use it to steam two small Maine lobster tails and it's great. I also steam about 2 cups of vegetables. Nothing else will fit in it. It's that small. The handles (both sets) do get very, very hot. And because it is so small, I've learned that I only need about a cup of water in the bottom pot. I also think that it is overpriced. It should be much cheaper. Other than that, it does work great :)
customer_reviews.author: WifeyReviews

customer_reviews.title: Zero stars for this product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I dont know who wrote 5 stars for this product. I ordered to cook baby food. All got black and has strange smell on something burned. I will ask for returne. Not safe for use!!! I will update and add photos too.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppinghollik

customer_reviews.title: Love This Steamer!
customer_reviews.text: My grandmother gave me a set of Farberware in the 80's. I bought and wore out several other sets of cookware over the years but still had a 2 qt. saucepan from grandma's set that I reached for every day. I recently bought this steamer and several other pieces of Farberware Classic. They are as good as grandma's! This steamer is a great size and serves double duty as a pasta pot, chili pot, etc., with the steamer insert removed. It is also very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: aquablues

customer_reviews.title: Holds up!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this steamer for a year now, and use it at least three times a week. It performs like the day it arrived. Many uses, plenty of stirring in the base, and doesn't show any wear. Handles are still tight, no chips, still glossy black. One hell of a purchase, I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Beech

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Does an awesome job steaming the perfect portion of veggies for one person. Is very cute/compact but handles are not heat proof at all. You will burn your finger off if you try to lift the pan. Also the lid got some stains on the metal just from a few uses. Really though it's a great pot and I'm very happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Best Steamer I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Farberware Stainless Steel cookware for over 30 years. This is the best steamer I've ever used. I now have 2 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce M. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer
customer_reviews.text: Loved this so much that I bought one as a gift for my sister. Great product. Handles do get hot but other than that’s it’s perfect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: if you like the fact it a little small .but very nice . very well made ......great for 3 maybe 2 people that does not eat a lot ( 2 ADULTS AND CHILDREN ) IT GREAT AND EVEN COOK PASTA IN IT !! LOVE THE SIZE AND CANT BEAT FARBERWARE COOK WARE IT GOOD QUALITY COOKWARE ,I HAVE BEEN USING FOR 20 YEARS .......THAT HAS NOT CHANGED . WAS WORRIED THEY DID NOT MAKE QUALITY ANYMORE FOR A LOW COST ,GLAD I FOUND THE CLASSIC STAINLESS STEEL ...........I THOUGHT THEY MAY HAVE STOPPED MAKING THIS . GREAT PRODUCT LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: CANT WIN THEM ALL

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Induction  countertop burner
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for use as a small "dutch oven" for one, on my induction burner, with the steaming feature as a bonus. I like to use that burner because it has a timer which will shut off in the event I have a health incident, or forget I put it on. Good sturdy saucepot.
customer_reviews.author: Vermont Senior

customer_reviews.title: Great pot/steamer, better than expected
customer_reviews.text: My another favorite piece in a kitchen!! It is well made, neat, sleak, great quality for the price! There are only two of us in a household, so size of this pot is perfect, enough to cook a dinner for both of us!! I use it to steam dumplings on a top level and botom pot for cooking pasta or soup. Love its multifunctionality! Since I bought it last month, I have already used it for a dozen times, and it is still looks brand new, no fire or other marks appeared as I read in other reviews. Would reccomend to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn G.

customer_reviews.title: ... received by new stainless Steel 3 Quart Steamer and love it adding to my original Farberware set of 50 ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received by new stainless Steel 3 Quart Steamer and love it adding to my original Farberware set of 50 years and still looks like new. No other pots compare to the quality that has lasted all these years and thrilled I was able to find a replacement for my steamer that I unfortunately ruined. Now I can steam my vegetables easily like I always have and cleanup is a breeze. Highly recommend and if you don't have the original set you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer

customer_reviews.title: Kinda small, but good quality
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be high quality, it's very heavy durable. It's a good bit smaller than I anticipated. I wanted something I could steam tamales in and I can maybe fit 2 or 3 in here tops. When looking at pictures it seemed bigger than what I got, but I guess that's my own mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Wednesday H. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Great multi purpose pot
customer_reviews.text: I've had several of these over the last few years. I find them very handy for steaming, of course, but also use it for pasta, and rice. The steamer part works great as a colander for draining pasta, and I also use it to rinse berries or salad ingredients. I love kitchen items that are multi-purpose. My original pot had a glass lid that was great to see what was cooking, but it shattered one day. I'm happy they changed to the metal lids for safety reasons. My latest pot does show the discoloration in the bottom of the pan, but it's not a big deal to me.
customer_reviews.author: ILuvMaine

customer_reviews.title: Big and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I stream vegetables at least several times a week, and this set is great. It's much sturdier and has a larger capacity than those foldable streamer baskets that I used to use.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Heavy bottom for even cooking
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised and impressed by how heavy the bottom of this pan is. I didn't realize it would be clad bottomed. This helps out greatly for even heating. Overall very impressed with this little pan. Handles feel a little cheap tho.
customer_reviews.author: LTZ

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as past
customer_reviews.text: I had this exact set from years ago, loved the size and found many uses for it. I just don’t think the new pot is the same quality. The old one was polished stainless, inside and out. The new one seems to be brushed inside, not smooth.
customer_reviews.author: J G

customer_reviews.title: Whose lifetime?
customer_reviews.text: It has been excellent in all respects for several weeks of moderate use. We withheld the 5th star because of the reservations in the "lifetime guaranty." The "lifetime" guaranteed is the "lifetime of the cookware."
customer_reviews.author: violee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size, Great Quality, Easy To Clean
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic steamer. If you have been using the collapsable steamer baskets you use in a normal pot, you will hate yourself for not getting a dedicated steamer pot before now. This pot is a great size, not too large or small, able to hold a full broccoli head with a bit of room to spare. The base of the pot is surprisingly heavy duty. Very pleased. The basket is much easier to clean than those collapsable steamer baskets too.
customer_reviews.author: Ossie Moore

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality
customer_reviews.text: After 2months of use bottom changed color. I have glass cook and was cooking very carefully, used only for steaming veggies and fruits for baby. If tou are going to use it once or twice a week it might be ok. But in my opinion it is not good to use everyday. I do not suggest it. Very dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Parvana

customer_reviews.title: Nice finish, great fit and perfect utility
customer_reviews.text: If your cooking needs are simple this is all the pot you need. It is a saucepan, a steamer and for fixing pasta it is your collender too. If your fan steamers are falling apart, this pan is easier to clean after steaming vegetables. Nice finish, great fit and perfect utility. What is not to love.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality!  Much too thin
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the quality of this product! It is thinner than my original Farberware pots and pans.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette barry

customer_reviews.title: Farberware does it again!
customer_reviews.text: This was the solution to all my vegetable steaming problems! We used to use that cheap collapsible veggie steamer that broke every few months and we just kept replacing it. The "leaves" would come undone and you'd have to bend them back in place...and it never goes back in the same way. So we got this and it works beautifully. Durable stainless steal that comes with a pot and a top. Would recommend and buy again!
customer_reviews.author: GuitarGuy310

customer_reviews.title: Great Veggie Steamer
customer_reviews.text: I use this to steam fresh vegetables. It holds quite a bit. Very sturdy. Easy to clean. I use it almost everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Linda C. Eiden

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not good handles
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this steam pot as I steam veggies a lot. Overall, the pot does its work well, but there are some downsides. I wish it could come with glass lid so that I can easily see the veggie thru the lid that not being over steamed. The most disappointed part of the pot is the the handles. Since the handles are plastic, they have been burned over time.
customer_reviews.author: SSZ

customer_reviews.title: Great little steamer
customer_reviews.text: This pot is surprisingly heavy. It is obviously made from good material. The steamer and the lid fit well, so there is not a lot of steam escaping from the pot. It's not a large pot, but you can easily steam enough vegetables for a family of four. I had read some of the reviews on here, and most of them said that the handles get very hot. That's true, but no hotter than the handle of any other pot like this. I'm used to using a pot holder anyway. I also noticed that some of the reviews mention discoloration in the bottom pot. I have not seen this.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. Brenneis

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, especially at this price point. There could have been more holes (and smaller) to steam more thoroughly and evenly, but what we have is good enough. Just make sure there is water (duh!) and you donot run out of water in the process which will burn it (happened last night with my unit). I just burned my unit. My fault, I forgot I had that on while steaming chicken and burned it. I will probably be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Happy Shopper
customer_reviews.text: I love this steamer. I own two. The ones with the holes in the lid always spray water all over my stovetop. This one is well behaved, no messes. I sometimes use a clear glass cover (without holes) that I have from another pot, this way I can see what is going on in the pot, but I wouldn't trade the pot for anything.
customer_reviews.author: shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like the quality of this. It's not too heavy and cleans up very easy. ***Update on this product - this sauce pan still has not chipped nor showed any scratches. I've used it in the dishwasher several times. When I've hand washed it, it cleans up quite easily still. I think it's great that this pan is made of safe materials. I really love the quality of this stainless steel sauce pan and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Love

customer_reviews.title: Farberware quality. Looks great. Will last decades if treated nice.
customer_reviews.text: It is stainless, therefore, not the easiest to clean, but it is stainless and will last a very long time. I am going to get all Farberware stainless and one or two Teflon pans for frying.
customer_reviews.author: Hereticus

customer_reviews.title: This is great to steam vegetables
customer_reviews.text: This is great to steam vegetables. I buy the family size bags and just steam the right amount for me, which is so much cheaper than the steam in the bag name brand ones. Good quality stainless steel. Love Farberware cookware and have used it for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Snickerdoodle

customer_reviews.title: Great for steaming and cooking.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried different brands and styles of cooking ware over many years. I have returned to my original Choice of 40 years ago, Farberware . I Love cooking with these pots. They are lighter weight, easier to manage and I love being able to scour them,. The pots maintain the original finish forever.
customer_reviews.author: Clare Casale

customer_reviews.title: To easy
customer_reviews.text: So glad I invested in this steamer..look up minutes to steam/each veggie....yummy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to be as described and the delivery was very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Claudio Silva

customer_reviews.title: This is a great steamer
customer_reviews.text: I never wanted to hassle with the trouble of a bamboo steamer. This pot works great for quickly getting good results with fresh and frozen veggies. In retrospect I think I might need a bigger one and I may buy one that has a larger capacity, but that isn't the fault of the product. This does a great job and with a quick rinse of hot water and toss it in the dishwasher it's clean. I have had no issues with quality at all. This was a great buy for the price and I presume it will last my entire lifetime. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: M. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good steamer but . . .
customer_reviews.text: I brought this steamer because I don't want to continue to use my microwave to reheat leftovers. I would definitely recommend this product but with this disclaimer: "very good steamer except when reheating rice. The holes are too large and the rice falls through". Of course, this can be easily remedied with the use of aluminum foil at the base of the steamer. Perfect for steaming veggies. Farberware continues to be an excellent manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: D.L. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for price
customer_reviews.text: Good stainless steel steamer. The only issue I have is that the holes do not reach towards the bottom edges and sometimes food can get stuck there because it dries out. Doubles as a pot when making soup!
customer_reviews.author: YELP Critic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for small servings
customer_reviews.text: Great size for steaming veggies/food for babies/toddlers or a side of veggies for 2 of us for dinner. When I wanted to steam a few servings of carrots or peas for my daughter, I didn't want to haul out the huge pasta pot. This small steamer is the perfect size. I'd say it fits a cup or two of veggies and steams quickly due to the small size. I can leave it right on the stove or it stores easily. Easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: YankeeInNC

customer_reviews.title: Great pot
customer_reviews.text: I have used Farberware for nearly 60 years - time to get a newer model - yea, I love cooking with Farberware.
customer_reviews.author: dino

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice quality steamer
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice quality steamer. I bought one and liked it so much bought a second one. The basket is large enough for lot but got the second one in the event did not want to combine the foods. Have used them several times especially great with asparagus or squash.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Quality USA Cookware
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase. Decided to buy a quality cookware made in USA and a known brand. I am very impressed and will be slowly replacing my cheaper cookware with Farberware. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: ACtoRead

customer_reviews.title: Extremely versatile and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a good cook, but this sturdy product does exactly what I need. It's attractive and compact and I can steam my veggies and boil my pasta/rice for 1 to 4 people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: Why have I been buying those little fold up steamers for soooo long?! This is great! It may be smaller than some folks are expecting. It is large enough for me to steam broccoli for my family of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Jess E.

customer_reviews.title: Faberware...a staple in the home
customer_reviews.text: I was requested to purchase a new 3 quart Farberware pot for Christmas. Finding a pot with a perfect matched steamer was an added bonus. Our only minor complaint is that this pot uses a double grip handle vs. the single stem handle. If it could have been the single stem pot with double handled steamer I think we would use the base pot more. Regardless, for the price, warranty, and brand to match all our other pots, this purchase was an easy one to make.
customer_reviews.author: B. D. Brault

customer_reviews.title: Super Recommended
customer_reviews.text: its a smashing success. Have been using it everyday! The side handles allow for easy removal with out burning finger tips that one gets when using the El Cheapo steam insert tray. And, best of all, I can also use the handles to lift the upper part of the steam pot to check that the boiling water is not getting low. That's hard to do with the steam insert tray because veggies invariably fall into the boiling water.
customer_reviews.author: raceinggreen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I just cook for me and my husband and wanted a reasonable sized steamer and pot. I have a 6 qt one I rarely use because it's way too big for 2 people. This pot is the *perfect* size for what I needed. As always with Farberware, this is a nice weight and quality. If you need to feed 10 people, this is not the pot for you. If you need to make servings for 2-4 people, this is a great size!
customer_reviews.author: A CTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect. It works great and is well made
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect. It works great and is well made. The handles on the steamer pan stay cool enough to pick up with your bare hands, but the bottom pot's handles are VERY hot. Use a potholder on those. Otherwise it' perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Anony Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! What more can I say? It is great for my use, just the right size for 2 people, if you like a large portions of veggies. Would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This steamer is awesome it's beautiful and heavy duty. I am very impressed with this utensil. Farberware makes some reasonably priced products with good quality
customer_reviews.author: Pat J

customer_reviews.title: Finally found one
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I finally found a wonderful little steamer for a price I was willing to pay. This is a very high quality product, nice and heavy and is a great addition to my kitchen. I have been looking high and low for a steamer that is small enough for two people and doesn't take up a lot of room and this one sure fits the bill. The saucepot is a nice size too and I will probably use that as much as I do the steamer.
customer_reviews.author: SandyW

customer_reviews.title: healthy food cooker
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this. It is sturdy and is everything you need for delicious steamed veggies and meat. The handles at times can get hot, but it's no problem with pot holders. This was a great price to keep the natural flavor in your food without depleting the nutrients like the microwave does. I don't even have to add seasoning. Just follow the directions on the instructions to uphold the maintenance of the pot and steamer. I hand wash all my pots.
customer_reviews.author: Virtue08

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mom for her birthday. She uses it all the time. Perfect gift for that lady thatS hard to shop for.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaK

customer_reviews.title: Not buying again...
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these and the stains don't go away no matter how many times you wash it. Not buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: ZEE RAJA

customer_reviews.title: I totally recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for one a little bigger but got this one because through the reviews it was the one that sounded the best and I have to say I don't regret at all getting it. I bought it to steam my son veggies and I have to say the size it's just perfect. If you are looking for a steamer this is a very good choice specifically if you want something BPA free which was what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything Pot
customer_reviews.text: I had searched & searched for a new soup/pasta/steamer pot & discovered this. It's perfect! I love the capacity too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: I have been using this one for a while and it is great. Broccoli
customer_reviews.text: I recently decided to change my eating habits. I read an article that said steaming or baking your veggies and meats instead of boiling in water helps to maintain the nutrients in them. I have been using this one for a while and it is great. Broccoli, carrots, green beens, etc.have a much better flavor that boiling. Shrimp is also great!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Berry

customer_reviews.title: Love this pot!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a multi-purpose pot/steamer to decrease my reliance on the microwave for cooking/steaming veggies. This pot set up is a great size. It takes up little space in the pantry. I like that I can use it without the steamer basket. I really like the quality of the pot. It is nice and sturdy and seems to cook evenly. I am now considering purchasing more of the Farberware Classic items.
customer_reviews.author: K.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great little pot
customer_reviews.text: I use this little pot to steam hard boiled eggs, rather than boil. They peel easily, even when freshly laid.
customer_reviews.author: Greyhound

customer_reviews.title: Makes great steamed veggies!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this steamer, so much that I bought one for my daughter-in-law. Great size and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I admit it; I am a lazy cook, but am trying ro eat healthy. This has been the BEST purchase ever! I cut up my veggies and put them in the steamer, put a little water in the pot, steam for 10 mins or so while I cook some chicken or fish in my toaster oven and voila! I have a healthy low- carb dinner! So easy, and some items steam within literally minutes! Great price, great product, easy clean-up! My fave!
customer_reviews.author: mdmd523

customer_reviews.title: Superior Steamer
customer_reviews.text: I steam vegatables every night and I love this pan! I also love that it has little handles on the sides so it's easy to store without a long handle sticking out! Definitely five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming Girl

customer_reviews.title: I wish the handles could be designed better
customer_reviews.text: I like the compact size of the steamer, when I can steam small potions of veggie for 1 - 3 people. The steamer is of good quality and weight. My only complain is the handles are too close to the pot and get too hot. I have to use gloves to handle the steamer.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Easy steamer
customer_reviews.text: I've used this multiple times to steam vegetables or even steamers (a type of shellfish) for dinner. I also use the bottom pot for making anything I would normally do in a pot. The size is convenient for a family of 4 or to augment the average kitchen. So far it feels very sturdy (as Farberware tends to be) and is surviving my working kitchen (and dishwasher requirements for all my cookware).
customer_reviews.author: Szu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two
customer_reviews.text: We love this pan because its stainless steel and the perfect size for steaming vegetables. The only issue I have had was I used it to boil water for practically all day and ruined the finish. Also, you can't use a bigger burner than the size of the pan because the handles are plastic and heat up. But we still love it, its easy to clean and perfect for just me and my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Toejam

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love Farberware!
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with Farberware's Classic line years ago and still love every purchase. This is the quality that i was expecting and a great size for steaming quick lunches or sides for dinner.
customer_reviews.author: JillU

customer_reviews.title: SOLID QUALITY PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This Farberware steamer is very solid quality product. It is a great value for the money. I would however prefer a glass lid with a hole for steam relief, but no doubt would have pay much more for that when I can find it. In the meantime, this is a great option in the $25 price range.
customer_reviews.author: R. SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Nice little pot
customer_reviews.text: I use it some in my quest to rid my kitchen of teflon as well as steaming more for nutrition. For its size and price it's excellent, much better quality than I was expecting and perfect for replacing my hard to clean steamer insert. I have this odd wish that the handles could hold up to greater oven temperatures, though not once have I actually desired to stick the steamer in the oven.
customer_reviews.author: T.L. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I use this to steam broccoli. Works perfectly and easy to clean. I am unable to find anything similar in stores unless I buy an entire set of expensive pots and pans. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good vegetable steamer, rice takes a work around though.
customer_reviews.text: I had to deduct one star because the holes in the bottom are not fine enough to steam rice. Much of the rice grains will fall through easily. The work around is using parchment paper, punctured with a bunch of small holes, lining the bottom. That one failing aside, this steamer is a great high quality cooking tool.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michail

customer_reviews.title: The handles get so hot the steamer is unusable. I would like to return it. So frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: This is not usable. The handles of the item get so hot when they are supposed to be coated with something that is to prevent that. We are unable to use this item and would like to return it.
customer_reviews.author: LCS

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the rolled edge on rim of pot and steamerFood gets trapped
customer_reviews.author: Curts Family

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I steam vegetables weekly and this works way better than the collapsible basket that I had before. Bonus on the 3 quart pot. It's the perfect in between size. Not too big or little. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: After about a month I have to say that I am extremely satisfied. The construction seems pretty good and steamed veggies ...
customer_reviews.text: Im one of those people who always looks at the negative reviews first to see what could happen if I purchased this. After about a month I have to say that I am extremely satisfied. The construction seems pretty good and steamed veggies come out great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steams veggies Quickly for Tasty Meals
customer_reviews.text: Great product for small family - I use it often to make a steam dish of veggies. This one replaced my older one as the handles broke, possibly from overuse or dishwasher use. I do not put this in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: V. L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: What is thing made for? Single servings? It’s so tiny
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Vanluven

customer_reviews.title: Love It A Lot!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received my Farberware 3 qt. Stack 'N Steam Saucepot today, 12/4/14. I used it immediately and really loved the craftsmanship. I have other Farberware pots and pans and love them too. It's easy to clean and steams vegetables just right. Very attractive piece. Strong and heavy too. I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn R. Carrier

product_meta.title: Farberware Classic Series Sauce Pot/Saucepot with Steamer Insert, 3 Quart, Silver
product_meta.description:
Sauce it, boil it, steam it, and simmer it with the versatile Farberware Classic Stack 'N' Steam Stainless Steel Saucepot and Steamer. From lobster pot to soup pot, this multipurpose cookware combo can be used with or without the steamer insert, and boasts a full cap base featuring a thick aluminum core surrounded by stainless steel for rapid, even heating on any stovetop, including induction. Heavy-duty stainless steel is polished to a mirror finish for a classic touch and the stacking steamer pot is dishwasher safe and oven safe to 350°F.

AMAZON.COM
Functional as well as beautiful, this 3-quart saucepot and 2-quart steamer insert are made of heavy 18/10 stainless steel polished to a mirror finish. The pot has an aluminum core in its base to spread heat quickly and evenly. The core is completely clad in stainless steel so, like the rest of the pot and the steamer, the pot bottom resists corrosion and discoloring and cleans up easily. Thick rolled rims add durability and make it possible to pour from the pot without dripping. Because the pot is 4-1/2 inches deep and comes with a tight-fitting, domed lid, it is roomy enough to simmer stocks and soups and can also be used for braising veal shanks or for cooking chili on the stovetop or in the oven. (The handles are oven-safe to 350 degrees F and stay cool on the stovetop.) The pot and steamer are dishwasher-safe and come with a lifetime warranty against defects. --Fred Brack

BRAND STORY
By

See more
feature_bullets: AWARD WINNING STEAMER: Multipurpose stainless steel steamer set awarded Best Stovetop Steamer for 2020 by Business Insider
STEAMER SET INCLUDES: Stack 'N' Steam 3-Quart Saucepot with Lid and steamer basket insert that works great as a lobster pot, a soup pot, or for veggies and corn on the cob
QUICK TO HEAT: A full cap base on the stacking steamer and saucepot features a thick aluminum core surrounded by stainless steel for rapid, even heating
BUILT TO LAST: Heavy-duty stainless steel construction of the sauce pot and steamer insert provides awesome durability and is polished to a mirror finish for a classic touch
ICONIC FARBERWARE DESIGN: The self-basting stainless steel lid and comfortable handles feature iconic Farberware styling and are oven safe to 350 degrees F
EASY CLEANING: This dishwasher safe stacking steamer combines technology with the style and easy-cleaning convenience that Farberware has delivered for decades
